2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
Hey, if anyone knows, I have a question. I want to use the same user on my phone as I have on my PC. I was assuming I could simply copy over the users.json to my Android phone.

1) Is this the right way of going about it?
2) If so, do you know where in the file system users.json is located on the PHONE? I can't find it for the life of me.

> [binsk](#comment_3_15Ly5RQ5gp7reDtphMSKPe7qxEUwdpRd9o): Hey, if anyone knows, I have a question. I want to use the same user on my phone as I have on my PC. I was assuming I could simply copy over the users.json to my Android phone. [...]

Finally managed to find it. For reference to others, the location is:
/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/net.mkg20001.zeronet/files/zero/data/

1565888794_15rMfe5FVSWwMffJvTpBUq9dFiLQP.body: There is one for Android, I've been using it pretty much daily. Can't speak for iOS, though.
